load_public_data[source]

load_public_data(in_path, out_path='data/public.pickle')

Load public data and output processed data in pickle format.

Process include:

  1. Dropping 'foodimage_file_name' column.

  2. Handling the format of time by generating a new column, 'original_logtime_notz'

  3. Generating the date column, 'date'

  4. Converting time into float number into a new column, 'local_time'

  5. Converting time in the 'local_time' column so that day starts at 4 am.

  6. Converting time to a format of HH:MM:SS, 'time'

  7. Generating the column 'week_from_start' that contains the week number that the participants input the food item.

  8. Generating 'year' column based on the input data.

  9. Outputing the data into a pickle format file.

@param in_path : input path

@param out_path: output path

@return: nothing is returned.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
load_public_data('data/test_food_details.csv')

data is saved at data/public.pickle
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

prepare_baseline_and_intervention_usable_data[source]

prepare_baseline_and_intervention_usable_data(in_path, baseline_expanded_out_path='data/public_basline_usable_expanded.pickle', intervention_out_path='data/public_intervention_usable.pickle')

Filter and create baseline_expanded and intervention groups based on in_path pickle file. @param in_path : input path, file in pickle format

@param out_path: output path

@return: nothing is returned.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
prepare_baseline_and_intervention_usable_data('data/public.pickle')

 => filtering_usable_data()
  => using the following criteria: 40 items and 12 days logged in two weeks.
  => # of public users pass the criteria: 9
 => filtering_usable_data()
  => using the following criteria: 20 items and 8 days logged in two weeks.
  => # of public users pass the criteria: 5
baseline_expanded data is saved at data/public_basline_usable_expanded.pickle
intervention data is saved at data/public_intervention_usable.pickle
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

adherent[source]

adherent(s)

return True if the there are more than 2 loggings in one day w/ more than 4hrs apart from each other.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

most_active_user[source]

most_active_user(in_path, n, user_day_counts_path='data/public_top_users_day_counts.csv')

@param in_path : input path, file in pickle format

@param n: number of users with most number of logging days

@param user_data_counts_path: output path for top_users_day_counts in csv format

@return: top_users_day_counts dataframe

This function returns a dataframe in csv format that finds top n users with the most number of days that they logged.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
most_active_user('data/public.pickle',5,'data/public_top_users_day_counts.csv')

user day counts data is saved at data/public_top_users_day_counts.csv
day_count
unique_code
alqt45631586569 145
alqt8668165687 135
alqt21525720972 89
alqt78896444285 81
alqt14018795225 60
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

convert_loggings[source]

convert_loggings(in_path, parsed_food_path='data/public_all_parsed.csv', ascending=False)

@param in_path : input path, file in pickle format

@param parsed_food_path : output path for cleaned food loggings in csv format

@return: frequency count of food loggings in the descending order by default

This function takes in a pickle file, convert all the loggings into individual items of food and count the frequency of all food loggings.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
convert_loggings('data/public.pickle')

All food is parsed!
cleaned food loggings is saved at data/public_all_parsed.csv
All food is counted!
